title: Illegal Desfloration
html:
Deforestation illegal in Brazil is not out of control.

It is within the average of the last 20 years, and since 2012 it has been growing, but for structural reasons. The lack of economic development in the region does not leave many alternatives for the more than 20 million people who live there.

In addition, budgetary difficulties due to the economic emergencies faced and the lack of interest by state authorities to assist in command and control actions also increase the pressure on illegal deforestation.

it is necessary to develop the region in such a way that the individuals themselves have sustainable alternatives and keep the forest standing. This is the agenda of the future.

Useful information

  • E m 2020 o   MMA launched Plano   National for the Control of Illegal Deforestation and Recovery of Native Vegetation (2020-2023)   which unifies and enhances previous plans. While carrying out command and control actions, it recognizes those who live and protect forests by by means   innovation and impact investing.
  • The Program to Combat Illegal Deforestation has five axes:
  • Payment for Environmental Services
  • Bioeconomy
  • Economic Ecological Zoning
  • Land Regularization / Zero Tolerance to illegal deforestation practices
  • 84% of the Amazon biome is preserved and protected (source: Embra pa Territorial )
  • Côdigo Florestal is one of the most advanced in the world
  • Private sector is fundamental:
  • 31% of Brazilian exports are products of biodiversity
  • 3 million people live off forestry and fishing activities in the region
  • US $ 53 billion potential / year with the bioeconomy in the North (source: ABBI – Brazilian Bioinnovation Association).

What Brazil has for you done

          Government

  • Actions to combat forest fires (training, equipment acquisition, combat strategy)
  • Improvement of command and control actions (Operation Green Amazon)
  • Improved monitoring, combining science and technology to provide better knowledge of illegal activities
  • Amazon

          Private Sector

  • Certification
  • Tracking
  • Bioeconomics with wood, such as those of BRRio, which promotes union between designers, artisans of Tapajôs wood and socioenvironmental responsibility
